channel.title: Mental Blur Replacement/Buff Ideas
channel.description:
Here are my 2 replacement ideas of mental blur and a buff for mental blur
Night Ability 2: Mental Author ~ Edit a player's logs. You will see your target's pre existing logs. If the player dies the edited logs that you made will appear instead of normal logs. 2 or 3 uses depending on how OP it is.
Or
Night Ability 2: Conduit Illusion ~ Make 2 players think they are getting conduited. There will be only 1 of person talking in the conduit chat box and you will be able to see their chat. hopefully this makes sense :) . 2 use
Or the buff Idea ~ Which I'm still trying to buff
Night Ability 2: Mental Blur ~ Erase a player's chat history. You will also get a copy of it. 2 use.

item.title: Mental Blur Replacement/Buff Ideas
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
You are suggesting something EVEN stronger than me, while you call my version “reaaaallly OP”. I don’t play ToS, so I cannot comment on that. I’m going to disregard this “if people cheat, it’s really weak” argument.

Snoops are way less rare, since Noble is starting BD and Illusionist needs to be the third convert and it needs to be an unseen game. Regardless, Snoop is also as you said metagameable, however it is still powerful, because it can access at least the singular claim the recipient has at that moment. Mental Blur will have the same base usefulness, because it can be combined with Assassin.

Confirmability is a risk, but that does not mean that all evil abilities need to be unconfirmable. Bewilder on Invoker, shouldn’t be removed, just because it reveals an Invoker is present to a single person. Knowing it is an outing ability, the user should be smart about using it. Herbalist’s drug is the same way for example.

By the way, Possessor can also facelift as BD with empty logs to try and get the court to think there would be an Illusionist. Even though, I really don’t think it is as blatant as you are making it seem.

item.description:
Solic:

Except your version allows the illusionist to also see the log AND even edit it accordingly, whereas in mine the information is just destroyed. That means the information is also destroyed for the Unseen. Your version is magnitudes above mine on the power scale.

I don’t see a problem with that though…ToS’s forger is almost has exactly the same ability and it is seen to be weak. Also yours is pretty swingy as it could be reaaaally OP or if metagamed reaaaally weak

Solic:

Illusionists are rare and I think you are highly overstating the damage meta gaming could do to my skill variant. Especially, because it will always have a function if the target will die tonight, because they do not get the chance to retrieve their private notes. Also it is very tedious to copy paste your logs into private notes every single night, just on the very very slight chance you’ll be Mind Blurred. I really do not see myself or any significant majority of the playerbase resorting to that.

Snoops are rare but people still write their second logs as evil in private logs instead of in their logs. After the metagaming I have seen in my time of playing… yeah I’m pretty a sure lot would.

Again mental blur (right now) is such an unhelpful ability imo that it can’t be fixed. You imo have fixed 1 problem with it which is buffing it but you still have confirmability and metagming as issues. It is a pretty decent ability but it has easy counters

item.title: Mental Blur Replacement/Buff Ideas
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
Some people have trouble writing down a single night action in time, but you suggest that the illusionist coordinates with their team, snoops the log of someone (which could be anything), and edits it in such a way to frame someone or protect the Unseen. That is a lot to do.

The illusionist gets a snoop++. It is overpowered. By destroying the logs, the unseen will also lose the information that might be stored in the log, so it does not have all of these benefits that it would have with your version.

Most of the time this will still boil down to working with Assassin. If you are already outing yourself to an alchemist/evil king/sorcerer, you are at a point in the game, where you don’t need to edit logs to save yourself.

item.title: Mental Blur Replacement/Buff Ideas
item.dc:creator: Solic
item.description:
I agree with this and I had also suggested it in another thread. Mental Blur is largely useless now, because it confirms the presence of an illusionist without really hindering the player, because the important information is stored in their logs. Removing their logs on top of their chat logs, will make it a lot more difficult to remember who claimed what again and will actually burden the recipient. This also opens up the possibility of the Illusionist and Assassin working together to kill someone and destroy their logs, limiting what information gets out. That is really powerful and will restore Mental Blur back to usefulness and possibly the primary ability of the Illusionist, if they do not know a BD investigative.

This will also open up the possible defense of “an illusionist mental blurred me”, for when you feel extra extra lazy as scum and don’t want to bother with logs. Not sure if that is a great thing.
